gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.subtitle: Through this 5-minute getting started guide, you'll learn how to create your first translation project, upload documents, and complete a full translation workflow.
gettingStarted.alert: Before you begin, make sure you have access to DeepTrans Studio. If not, please contact your administrator to create an account.

step1.title: Create Project
step1.description: After logging in, click the 'New Project' button to start. Fill in the project name and select source and target languages.
tips: You can create multiple language pairs simultaneously

step2.title: Upload Documents
step2.description: Supports multiple formats: DOCX, PDF, TXT, Markdown, etc. Drag and drop files or click the upload button.

step3.title: Document Parsing
step3.description: The system automatically parses document structure, extracts translatable content, and performs intelligent segmentation.

step4.title: Start Translation
step4.description: Enter the translation editor to use AI-assisted translation, terminology database, translation memory, and other features.

step5.title: Quality Check
step5.description: Use built-in quality assessment tools to check translation quality, including terminology consistency, grammar checks, etc.

step6.title: Export & Delivery
step6.description: After completing translation, export to original format or other formats while maintaining document style.

nextSteps.title: Next Steps
nextSteps.description: Now that you understand the basic process, explore more advanced features:

concepts.title: Core Concepts
concepts.subtitle: Understanding DeepTrans Studio's core concepts helps you use the system more efficiently. Here we introduce key terms, data structures, and working principles in the system.

project.title: Project
project.description: Top-level organizational unit containing complete translation work
details: One project corresponds to one translation task
Contains source language, target language, domain configurations
Supports team collaboration and permission management

document.title: Document
details: Supports multiple formats: DOCX, PDF, TXT, etc.

segment.title: Segment
segment.description: Smallest translation unit in a document
details: Contains source text and target text

terminology.title: Term
terminology.description: Professional domain vocabulary and translation pairs

workflow.title: Workflow
details: Contains multiple stages: translation, review, finalization

workflows.title: Workflows
workflows.subtitle: Translation, evaluation, post-editing, review and other process nodes and transitions.
items: Automatic pre-translation: Batch translate segments and update segment status.
Quality assessment: Call evaluation service, write results and logs.
Post-editing: Revise content in the editor and save.
